description:
If you are curious about what it is like to run a successful startup, then join us for Startup Founder 101. Hear candid talks by successful entrepreneurs, sharing best practices, strategies and mistakes to avoid from those who have done it before. How do you get started on your entrepreneurial journey? How do you find talented people to join your team? What is it really like to build a successful company?

Which Entrepreneurs will be there?

• Niko Nelissen, CEO TapCrowd (be.linkedin.com/in/nikonelissen)


• Gill Ruidant, Founder 2Houses  ( www.linkedin.com/in/gillruidant)

• Xavier Lempereur (be.linkedin.com/pub/xavier-lempereur/0/a49/51) & Florent Dubois (be.linkedin.com/in/florentdubois) co-Founders Isosize & IQRoom

Who Should Attend?

•   Anyone who has an idea for a startup or an early-stage company 

• Anyone that is interested in joining a new startup or looking for a co-founder

• Anyone curious about what it is like to build a successful startup

What are some of the topics?

• What is it like to be a founder?

• What are the first steps in an entrepreneurial journey?

•  How do you know if you have a good or bad idea

• How to recruit initial Co-Founders, employees and partners

and more...

The location is The Library in Brussels.

This event is free to attend. Join us for a fun evening! 

Interested in applying to the Founder Institute in Brussels go to: 

http://fi.co/?target=brussels#


This event is FREE, and we expect over 50 people in attendance. For more information, visit </a><a href="http://www.fi.co/e/17951/meetup">http://www.fi.co/e/18391/meetup

Check back for updates!
name: Startup Founder 101 (1/4) - a Kick-off to the Founder Institute

description:
Do you want to start your own company, but don't know where to get started? You are not alone. Every day millions of people got to jobs they don't enjoy, but few do something about it. At the “Employee to Entrepreneur” event, you can hear the stories, tips, and best practices of those who left their jobs to pursue their own startup company. Listen to the experiences of people just like you that have made the transition, and discuss any questions or concerns that you have. How do you know if you have a good idea? What are the first steps in an entrepreneurial journey? Join us for a fun evening!

Which Entrepreneurs will be there?

•  Filip Tack: CEO Nomadesk (be.linkedin.com/in/filiptack)

• Jeroen Corthout: Founder Salesflare.com (be.linkedin.com/in/jeroencorthout)


• Christophe Philemotte - Founder Pullreview (be.linkedin.com/in/christophephilemotte)


Who should Attend?

• Anyone who dreams of launching their own company

• Anyone with an idea for a new business either launched inside their employer or independently

• Anyone curious about being an entrepreneur someday

 

What are some of the Topics?

• What is the difference between being an employee versus being a founder?

• What to consider before becoming an entrepreneur?

• How do you know when the time is right to quit?

• What are the first steps in the entrepreneurial journey?

and more...


This event is free to attend. Join us for a fun evening!


Interested in applying to the Founder Institute in Brussels go to: 

http://fi.co/?target=brussels#

Sponsors:

The room is graciously sponsored by

• Betacowork Coworking Brussels

• ICAB Business & Technology Incubator

This event is FREE, and we expect over 50 people in attendance. For more information, visit </a><a href="http://www.fi.co/e/17951/meetup">http://www.fi.co/e/18701/meetup

Check back for updates!

venue.name: Betacowork Coworking Brussels  -   ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Pères Blancs

name: Startup Founder 101 (2/4) - Making the Leap from Employee to Entrepreneur

description:
Think you have a great startup idea or pitch? Would you like to get live feedback on your pitch from a Silicon Valley startup expert, without leaving your chair?

The Founder Hotseat is a live, interactive webinar designed to give aspiring entrepreneurs blunt and honest feedback on their startup ideas. During this webinar, viewers can pitch their startup ideas to Adeo Ressi, Founder & CEO of the Founder Institute, to receive analysis and feedback. The best pitches will even be invited on screen, to pitch Adeo live, via webcam simulcast. Even if you don't want to pitch, you are invited to RSVP, log on, and watch how an expert startup advisor evaluates new business ideas.

- THIS IS AN ONLINE EVENT: It will take place at http://fi.co/contents/hotseat

- RSVP & SUBMIT YOUR PITCH AT: http://bit.ly/founder_hotseat

About the Speaker: Adeo Ressi, Founder & CEO, Founder Institute
Adeo Ressi is the Founder & CEO of the Founder Institute, the world's largest startup accelerator and entrepreneur training program. In addition, Adeo started TheFunded.com, an exclusive community for entrepreneurs to rate and review venture capitalists. The Institute is the eighth start-up that Adeo has founded or built, four of which were acquired and three of which are still operating. Adeo is regarded as a worldwide expert on early-stage startups and venture capital, with numerous appearances in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Wired Magazine, NBC News, ABC News, BusinessWeek, Fortune, Forbes, Time Magazine, Entrepreneur, CNN, and more.

This Event is Hosted by the Founder Institute
If you are thinking about launching a company, then the Founder Institute may be a good option for you. In this part-time program, promising startup entrepreneurs “learn by doing” and launch a company through structured training courses, practical business-building assignments, and expert feedback from a large network of business mentors. To apply for free ($50 value), visit http://fi.co/apply/brussels/meetup
name: Get Expert Feedback on Your Startup Idea (Live Interactive Webinar Event)

name: Virtual Webinar: Get Feedback on Your Business Idea from Silicon Valley

description:
You want to do a startup and think your idea is the best one since sliced bread. If you like it, everyone will like it, right? Or, you may have no real ideas but still would like to do a startup. How do you generate good ideas that won't turn out to be really bad in retrospect. What do you need to take into account in the evaluation?

Which Entrepreneurs will be there?

• Koen Stevens, CEO of Bubox (be.linkedin.com/in/koenstevens)

• Others: TBD


Who Should Attend?

• Anyone who has an idea for a startup or an early-stage company and wants to validate this.

• Anyone who would like to do a startup without an idea and wants to know how generate good ones

• Anyone curious about what it is like to build a successful startup

What are some of the topics?

• How to identify good business ideas ... and bad ones

• What can you do if your idea turns out to be a bad one

• What to look out for when generating ideas; markets, partners, competitors ...

• Hear about success and failure stories

and more... The exact location is TBD but will be in Brussels.

This event is free to attend. Join us for a fun evening! Interested in applying to the Founder Institute in Brussels go to: http://fi.co/?target=brussels#
name: Startup Founder 101 (3/4) - Identifying Good Business Ideas

name: Pitch Your Idea to a Silicon Valley Startup Expert (Live Online Webinar)

description:
The Founder Institute is the world's largest idea-stage accelerator. Join us for an informational event where you can meet local Directors, ask questions and learn how you can launch a startup in Brussels with help from top CEOs, experienced peers and a structured approach. What is it like to be in the Founder Institute? Who are some of the peers that you will be working with? Can the Institute help you build your dream company?

Who Should Attend?


•  Anyone who has an idea for a startup or an early-stage company

• Anyone that is interested in joining a new startup or looking for a co-founder

• Anyone interested in learning about the Founder Institute program 

What is the Agenda?

•  Welcome and Socializing

• Introduction to the Founder Institute

• Question and Answer

• Attendee Introductions

• Discussion and Drinks at a Local Bar or Restaurant

This event is free to attend. Join us for a fun evening! Interested in applying to the Founder Institute in Brussels go to: http://fi.co/?target=brussels#
name: Startup Founder 101 (4/4) - Founder Institute Information Session

description:
If you have an idea for a startup that could use some refinement, then join us for the Startup Ideation Bootcamp.


In just three hours, this intensive workshop will help you improve your idea, come up with new ideas and even recruit potential co-founders. What are the components of a great idea? How do you know if you are working in an attractive market? How do you validate that your idea is great?
name: Startup Ideation Bootcamp

name: Get Expert Feedback on Your Startup Idea (Live Interactive Webinar Event)

description:
There is a lot of talk about what is takes to be a successful entrepreneur. 

The Founder Institute has tested people from around the world and know the characteristics of successful entrepreneurs. We’ll present the results of Belgian test takers vs. people around the world.


As a special guest, we are proud to announce Pieter Mees, Founder of Zentrick (www.zentrick.com) will come and talk about his journey to become an Entrepreneur. Zentrick technology provides ways to make videos truly interactive, has been used by globalbrands like the WSJ, Volkswagen, Unilever and others.

Zentrick is a great example of a Belgian startup that is an "instant success, years in the making" who had to pivot their business model several times over the years. They recently got $3m funding by Fortino the investment vehicle of Duco Sickinge (ex-CEO Telenet).

If you want to hear from a Belgian made to be entrepreneur, here is your unique opportunity!

This event is FREE, and we expect over 50 people in attendance. For more information, visit http://fi.co/e/18351/meetup


Check back for updates!
name: Are Belgians made to be Entrepreneurs?  Are you ?

description:
Do you have a business idea or product that needs funding? Do you want to learn how startup funding works, what you need to do before trying to raise funding, and where you can go to get it? Then join us for this beginner fundraising workshop, which will provide practical, step by step advice, and feature talks from entrepreneurs who have successfully raised money for their businesses and funding providers. Learn expert tips, big pitfalls to avoid, what investors are looking for, how equity works, and more. Join us for a great event!

• Claire Munck, CEO of Be Angels (www.beangels.eu) will speak about how to get early stage funding from Business Angels.

• iMinds will talk about the funding possibilities and other support they provide for startups.


• Pieter (Paycento) will speak about his experience pitching for more than 65 VC's and angels, his dealings with 'Innovation Centers', IWT, FIT and PMV, and how he used the funding he received from iMinds for early stage business development.


This event is FREE, and we expect over 50 people in attendance. For more information, visit http://fi.co/e/18411/meetup

Check back for updates!
name: Startup Funding 101: How to Raise Capital for Your Idea

description: Brussels is one of the world's fastest growing startup ecosystems, and entrepreneurs here are lucky to have so many resources available to help them in their journey. However, many people don't know about all of the resources available, the differences between them, or what resources are right for them. At "How to Start Up in Brussels", we will gather representatives from different entrepreneurial organizations to give a quick overview of who their audience is.
name: How to Start Up in Brussels

description:
This is the last information session before the Founder Institute starts. You’ll get to meet Frank Maene/ Volta Ventures. He has 40 million to invest in Benelux ICT start-ups.  He’ll share the secrets you need to know before talking to him or another VC or investor.

You’ll also get a last chance to ask questions about the Founder Institute and starting up in Belgium.

Hope to see you there !
name: The secrets of VC funding / Founder Institute Q&A
